Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 03:09PM LynnVA wrote: I very much liked the term pre-cancer and it bothered me at the same time.  Dont feel bad, you have breast cancer and it was found very early, and that is so important.  Dont let anyone make you feel like this is a contest for the worst pathology report.  I have been through a hell of a lot for my "pre cancer".  Didnt seem like anything "pre" about it to me or my family and I doubt it will be to you and yours.  Good luck and best wishes to you.

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2009 11:15AM LynnVA wrote: I'm almost 2 weeks out and just now starting to calm down.  I also had bad anxiety and could not sleep.  When I did it was  fitfull and never for very long. I was then and now still tired but have a very hard time shutting down and getting the sleep I need.  I am starting to feel so much better now.  Saw Rad/Onc today and she said when I crash I will crash hard and to calm down, I did it and its over.  Thank God!

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2010 11:02AM LynnVA wrote: I wore soft cotton tanks also from Target under everything after my mast, expansion, and during rads.  I have them in every color.  Mosimo brand I think. They are soft and stretch so I could just pull my arms out and not have to take it off during rads and doc appts.  Just now I'm trying to wear a bra some to get use to it again.  I am and always have been small chested so this worked well for me and was as comfortable as you can get going through that whole mess.  Good Luck to you :)
